text: Hot Coconut Chocolate Pour the coconut milk into the saucepan. Heat gently to a boil. Reduce to a simmer when it reaches boiling point. Put in the cocoa powder, stir to mix through. Add the cinnamon. Stir in. Drizzle the honey into the liquid. Stir through evenly. If using, add the coconut oil. This needs to be whipped in well to melt it thoroughly. It will thicken the mixture nicely. Pour into serving mugs or cups. Serve straight away. Toasted Coconut Mocha Make the whipped cream first, so that it's ready ahead of making the drink. Beat the heavy cream until it thickens, then add the powdered sugar and vanilla extract. Beat to form stiff peaks. It's ready at this point. Add 2 tablespoons of chocolate syrup and 1/2 teaspoon of coconut extract to each of two cups. Stir together. Pour the hot coffee into each cup. Stir to dissolve the syrup completely. Add a 1/4 cup of coconut milk and stir.  Add a topping of whipped cream. Sprinkle with toasted coconut. Serve immediately. This goes well with a coconut flavored treat. Iced Coconut Chocolate Make coconut milk ice cubes first. These are a key part of making this a lovely drink because they melt into the drink and create a delicious creaminess that has to be tried to be believed. Pour the coconut milk into the ice cube tray. Place the tray in the freezer and allow to freeze. Make the chocolate drink. Pour the cups of chilled hot chocolate into a blender. Add the coconut oil, cocoa powder and vanilla extract. Blend to combine thoroughly. Pour into the drinking glass(es). Add the coconut ice cubes. Serve immediately. Enjoy.
